I'll tell you one thing: we are not here by chance. We are near the ancient Kingdom of Dyfed, a territory connected with Annwn, the Underworld. Here, we are close to all the gods and goddesses, because this is the time of their fall. The gods of Annwn are now the most powerful. I am a follower of Bran, god of the Underworld, whose eminence is most often associated with his 'Wonderful Head.' Bran is also the patron of bards, minstrels, and musicians. You should pray to him.
Human sacrifices? You're a fool!
In realtà, dimentico.
Who are you and what do you want? We are not used to visitors here.
I am {playername}, sir. Who are you?
I am {playername}, but I haven't got time for you.
I see that you came loaded with wheat for my people. Thank you!
You... You stole our money and left us without food. I don't want to see you ever again.
{playername}, per favore torna con del cibo.
I like to be of help.

Thank you! We are poor and cannot offer more than our friendship, but whenever you come here, you will be welcome. Moreover, I'll give you one of my sons to serve you as a soldier. He is a strong and brave boy.

I told him to go to pack up and join you when you leave this place. Thank you so much, {playername}. You saved our lives! Now we will return to our caves and hide for a while longer in this terrible world.
Welcome, {playername}! What can I do for you?
Remind me who you are.
I haven't got time for you.
-He smiles.-^^I live here with my family, which has been here for several generations. An ancestor of mine, who took up a residence here, was said to be a Roman, or perhaps he was of Roman lineage.

The place where you have set your foot is Vallum Aelium, Hadrian's Wall. It became the frontier of civilization here, in the far north, after the Romans abandoned the Antonine Wall. Farther north, there are only Caledonians and Picts, impoverished and wild people not worth conquering.^^Vallum Aelium was garrisoned by auxiliari, non-legionary troops. My ancestor was one of those auxiliari, who became a citizen after fulfilling his military service for Rome. I was told another story about a hero in the days of King Penda who helped my family in difficult times.
Roma Victrix, old man.
Roma era grande, vecchio.
The thought of Rome disgusts me, old man.
Oh, it is good you know about the Romans or have at least heard of them. You seem like a person that I can trust. I have a favor to ask... We need your help.

I understand. For me Rome means nothing. It is part of my past, but only part was Roman. In fact, I am more Briton and Angle than Roman. At any rate, you seem like a person that I can trust. I have a favor to ask... We need your help.

Recent invasions have complicated things a lot here in the north. We live well hidden in the caves to the east, but come to this place when we need food, for merchants often stop here on their way to trading towns. At present, we've been waiting for weeks and no merchant has come... We had a bad harvest and desperately need food. Could you bring us eight sacks of wheat? I will give you money in advance.
I will be happy to help you.
I haven't got time for this.
Thank you. Take this money and return as soon as possible. We have hungry children crying.
I am busy. Talk to the foreman.
Molto bene, buon uomo. Addio.
What do you want? Can't you see that I am busy?
Si?
Watch how you speak to me, man, or I shall give you a painful reply.
Bah! I haven't insulted you, and the laws protect us. I have better things to do.
I want my slaves to work here.
You haven't finished your work yet. As I said, the stone down here must be broken out of the earth.
Mi piacerebbe lavorare qui.
We have use for a day laborer. We pay five peningas per day.
Non sono interessato.
Very well, I want to work one day here.
The stone down here must be broken out of the earth. Here is a pickaxe.
Sorry, my {reg59?lady:lord}, but this place is our place. This place belonged to our fathers and before them, our grandparents. Only my men and my slaves work here.
I'd like to buy some of whatever you're mining here.
Sorry, I have just promised the rest to someone else.
Molto bene. Vorrei comprare qualcosa.
Veramente, preferirei parlare di altre cose.
Vorrei vendere tutti i miei prigionieri a te.

Well, I will pay you a flat 15 peningas for each prisoner, as I don't care about their quality or their past. If such things matter to you, I guarantee that they will never escape from here. Do we have a deal?
Yes, this is acceptable.
Let me think about it.
Thank you. I could use new hands.
I take my leave now.
Welcome, stranger, to our salt mine.
Anything else I can do for you?
What is happening here?
Salt. Work. More salt. As you can see. Now I have things to do.
You haven't finished your work yet. As I said, in the tunnel next to me, the salt must be struck out of the mountain.
Mi piacerebbe lavorare qui.
We have use for a day laborer. We pay five peningas per day.
Non sono interessato.
Very well, I want to work one day here.
In the tunnel next to me, the salt must be struck out of the mountain. Here is a pickaxe.
Voglio comprare un po' di sale.
Well, you've come the right place. {s4}
Sorry, I just sold the last sack of salt to someone else.
Molto bene. Vorrei comprare qualcosa.
Vorrei vendere tutti i miei prigionieri a te.

Well, I will pay you a flat 30 peningas for each prisoner, as I don't care about their quality or their past. If such things matter to you, I guarantee that they will never escape from here. Do we have a deal?
Yes, this is acceptable.
Let me think about it.
Thank you. I could use a few new hands.
I take my leave now.
You're not getting any money from me!
Aye, this is a work camp.
In quale altro modo posso aiutare?
You haven't finished your work yet. As I said, the wood next to me needs to be cut into smaller pieces, and the trees behind this house have to be felled.
Mi piacerebbe lavorare qui.
We have use for a day laborer. We pay four peningas per day.
Non sono interessato.
Very well, I want to work one day here.
The wood next to me needs to be cut into smaller pieces, and the trees behind this house have to be felled. Here is your axe.
Such nice trees, but they burn easily. I could ensure that they don't -- for a small fee.
Oh? Well, it's true that I do not like fires. I will pay your... fee.
You have done well, my man. We'll make sure nothing happens to you or your camp.
Is this some sort of a bad joke? I have no time for your nonsense.
Voglio comprare un po' di legname.
Devo andare.
Certo! {s4}
Sorry, one of the lords in the area just requisitioned whatever we had.
Very well. I would like to buy some.
You are not going to see a pening from us!
Welcome to our farm. Please help yourself to some bread and ale. How may I help you?
In quale altro modo posso aiutarvi?
Ci sono problemi nella zona, e la tua fattoria è così bella. Posso proteggerla -- a pagamento.
Trouble? There's no trouble... Oh, I see. Yes, we want no trouble. We will pay you.
Well done, my man. I assure you, trouble will stay far from you.
Trouble? Bother me again, and I'll show you trouble!
You haven't finished your work yet. As I said, the hay in the two wheat fields near the courtyard must be piled up.
Mi piacerebbe lavorare qui.
We have a use for a day laborer. We pay three peningas per day.
Non sono interessato.
Very well, I want to work one day here.
The hay in the two wheat fields near the courtyard must be piled up. Here is a pitchfork.
I see some of your men are loitering around. Can I hire some of them?

To tell the truth, my {reg59?lady:lord}, my servants and slaves breed like rabbits and eat too much of the produce. It would please me to sell the excess, and I'll give you a good price. One hundred peningas for the lot.
Sounds good. Here is the money, how many men can you give me?
Oh, I'm afraid I disagree. That's a little excessive.
{reg0} lads in all.
Che cosa avete in vendita?
Devo andare.
My lord has just sent a word that he needs the rest of what I have for a feast.
I'm interested. Let me see.
No, I'm looking for something else.
I have {reg25} cattle with me. May I have them kept here?
We can do that, {playername}.
Unfortunately, {playername}, we have too many cattle as it is.
Grazie.
Good day, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.
Hello, stranger. You seem to be new to {s9}. I am the reeve of this fort.
Buongiorno, {playername}.
I have heard that you found the perpetrator and recovered my valuable {s13}. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas.
I heard that you lost a fight against the runaway guard and my valuable {s9} is gone forever. I am very disappointed, {playername}, as I've heard so many good things about your reliability.

I have heard about your deeds. You have given those bandits the punishment they deserved. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas. I would like to give more but those bandits almost brought me to bankruptcy.
Cosa posso fare per Vossignoria?
Ora... Cos'altro posso fare per voi?
Si?
Quali sono le vostre mansioni?
Who rules this castle?

This fort's lord and protector is {s10}. {s10} resides here and collects taxes from the local populace. However, when my lord is not around, I manage matters and execute the law in my lord's stead. As the castle's reeve, I have the authority to decide those things.{s33}
Era tutto ciò che volevo sapere. Grazie.
I need to send a message to one of the lords.
I can do that, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. To whom would you like to send the message?
No, a nessuno di loro. Più tardi, forse.
Very well, you'd like to send a message to {s4}. What is the message about?
Actually, I changed my mind
I would like to ask him to come to my help here.
I would like to ask him to meet me somewhere.
I would like to send him a gift.
Very well. Consider it done, your highness.
Very well. What kind of gift do you want to send?
I would like to send him bracelets and rings worth 1000 peningas.
I would like to send him bracelets and rings worth 3000 peningas.
I would like to send him bracelets and rings worth 5000 peningas.
Actually, I changed my mind
Very well. Consider it done, your highness.
Very well. Where would you want him to travel?
No, a nessuno di loro. Più tardi, forse.
Very well, I'll send a messenger to {s32} and ask him to meet you in {s4}.
Avete del lavoro per me?
In merito al lavoro che mi avete offerto...
In merito al lavoro che mi avete offerto...
In merito al lavoro che mi avete dato...
Good day, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.
Hello stranger, you seem to be new to {s9}. I am the mayor of the town.
Buongiorno, {playername}.

{playername}, it was an incredible feat to get the {s14} and the {s15} to make peace, and you made it happen. Your involvement has not only saved our town from disaster, but it has also saved thousands of lives, and put an end to all the grief this bitter war has caused. As the townspeople of {s19}, know that we'll be good on our word, and we are ready to pay the {reg12} peningas we promised.
Grazie. Prenderò il denaro, dunque.
Non c'è bisogno che mi paghiate. L'ho fatto perché ritenevo fosse giusto e onorevole.
Oh, yes, of course. We had already got the money for you. Here, please accept these {reg12} peningas together with our most sincere thanks. Me and the people of our town will not forget your help.

You are indeed an extraordinary person, {reg59?madame:sir}, and it is an honour for me to have known you. You not only did what was impossible and put an end to this terrible war, but you won't even accept a reward for it. Very well, I will not insist on the matter, but please know that you will have our eternal respect and gratitude.
Very nice work, {playername}, you made short work of those lawless curs. Thank you kindly for all your help, and please accept this bounty of 150 peningas.
È stato un piacere, {s65}.
Ah, {playername}. Do you have any progress to report?
Ho ucciso dei predoni.
Non ancora, signore. Arrivederci.

Aye, my scouts saw the whole thing. That should make anyone else think twice before turning outlaw! The bounty is 40 peningas for every band, so that makes {reg1} in total. Here is your money, as promised.

And that's not the only good news! Thanks to you, the looters have ceased to be a threat. We've not had a single attack reported for some time now. If there are any of them left, they've either run off or gone deep into hiding. That's good for business, and what's good for business is good for the town! I think that concludes our arrangement, {playername}. Please accept this silver as a token of my gratitude. Thank you, and farewell.
Avete bisogno di qualcos'altro?
Good to see you again, {playername}. I have heard that you have delivered the cattle successfully. I will tell the merchants how reliable you are. And here is your pay, {reg8} peningas.
I heard that you have lost the cattle herd on your way to {s9}. I had a very difficult time explaining your failure to the owner of that herd, {reg59?madam:sir}. Do you have anything to say?
I heard that you lost a fight against the runaway guard and my valuable {s9} is gone forever. I am very disappointed, {playername}, as I heard so many good things about your reliability.
I am sorry, but I was attacked on the way.
Mi dispiace. Alcuni animali sono scappati durante la notte...

Well, it was your responsibility to deliver that herd safely, no matter what. You should know that the owner of the herd demanded to be compensated for his loss. I had to pay him 1000 peningas, so you now owe me that money.

{playername} -- Sono in debito con voi per aver fatto ritornare la figlia del mio amico. Per favore prendete questi {reg8} denari, sono quelli che vi ho promesso.  Il mio amico desiderava che vi dessi di più ma il pagamento del riscatto lo ha ridotto sul lastrico. Comunque vi ringrazia.

Well -- it sounds like you were able to track down the bandits, and show them what happens to those who would disrupt the flow of commerce. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas. It is well earned, and we are most grateful.

I have heard about your deeds. You have given those bandits the punishment they deserved. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas. I would like to give more but those bandits almost brought me to bankruptcy.
I have heard that you found the perpetrator and recovered my valuable {s13}. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas.
According to my accounts, you owe the merchants guild {reg1} peningas. Would you like to pay this off now?
Bene. Pagherò il mio debito.
Eccellente. Riferirò ai miei amici commercianti che avete intenzione di cancellare il vostro debito.
Temo di non poter pagare questa somma attualmente.
In that case, I am afraid, I can't deal with you. Guild rules... Come back when you can pay the {reg1} peningas. We'll be charging interest on your debt, so the sooner you pay it, the better.
Cosa posso fare per Vossignoria?
Ora... Cos'altro posso fare per voi?
Si?
Quali sono le vostre mansioni?
I've heard that the grandchildren of Flaithbertach are here. Did you know that?
About Flaithbertach's grandchildren...

Yes, everyone has heard of them. The children of the son of Flaithbertach mac Niall, the brother of Aed mac Niall, ri h-Erenn uile, called 'Findliath,' or 'Fair Warrior.' Flaithbertach's untimely death gave Aed access to the throne of Aileach. Flaithbertach's family had a bad end too, but two of his children escaped with the two grandchildren. I heard that one of the two who escaped died recently. I feel sorry for him. So very tragic.
Could you tell me where to find them?
I have some silver that I want to give to this town (1000 peningas)
I have some silver that I want to give to this town (3000 peningas)
I have some silver that I want to give to this town (5000 peningas)
Hiding somewhere where they cannot be found. They have many enemies.
Your gift is welcome in these difficult times. I'll let the people of this town know of your interest in their welfare.
I am very interested to know where Flaithbertach's grandchildren are.
I must find them. This silver could help (1000 peningas)
I must find them. This silver could help (3000 peningas)
I must find them. This silver could help (5000 peningas)

You look like a trustworthy sort, and I do not owe anything to Flaithbertach's grandchildren, but I would like in return service to my community. Make their life better so that they love you in this town, and then we'll talk again.

You have done a lot for this town, and people appreciate you. I give you now what you seek: Flaithbertach's grandchildren are in a farm near Dinas Bran. I don't know why you are so interested in them. They are only two children eight years old. They are alone in life after the death of their father. I understand that Aed Findliath wants to get rid of any pretender to his throne, but these children have no one to support them. They are hardly a danger to him.
Children grow, Donngal. Anyway, this is none of our concern. Farewell.
I will save these poor children.

Glad to hear that! I interpreted by your words that the murderers of Flaithbertach sent you find his grandchildren. If you go back to them and tell them that you have not found anything, they will continue looking for them. If you really want to keep these children safe, you need to lie. You must go back to Aed Findliath and tell him where the children are. Meanwhile, I could have Flaithbertach's grandchildren moved to another farm and put two young slaves in their place.
That will work. Do it.
No, other children aren't the solution.

They're just slaves, but it's your decision. I can find safety for Flaithbertach's grandchildren. I guess you can go back to your lord and tell him where the farm is. They will find the farm empty, but you will have a few weeks before they do. Then you must leave Eriu, where Ard Ruire Aed mac Niall will become your worst enemy.
Very well, I'll take care of everything. Thankfully, the wergild for little slaves is not much. Good luck.
Forget what I said. We will follow your idea about using little slaves.
I can carry the hatred of a king better than the weight of the death of two children.
Very well, I'll take care of everything. Good luck; Ard Ruire Aed is a terrible enemy.
My good man, can you tell me about this place?

I certainly can. You definitely posed your question to the right man. I grew up here in Lundenwic and have seen the town grow bigger every year. It must be the busiest town in all of Mierce. One can't see the harbour from here, but it's bustling with activity, ships coming in all day long. One can make a nice profit setting up an enterprise here.

If one walks further east, down the river, one can see the ruins of the Roman town that once was there, but I wouldn't bother. There's hardly anything left there but rubble and silence now. When the Romans left, they took all the trade and engineering skills with them, so the place slowly crumbled into dust. Fortunately, that's all in the past now.
Greetings. Could you perhaps tell me about this place?

I surely can. Did getting up here bring sweat to your forehead? I bet it did! You're probably too proud to admit it, but everyone must catch their breath once they reach the town walls. It's not just from being amazed by the majestic size of this place but also from ascending the steep path leading up here. You've come to the royal town of Bernaccia: Bebbanburh. This is where our kings resided centuries ago.

No doubt you understand why it was made the royal seat. With the sea on one side, cliffs on the other and just a narrow path leading up here, it's a well-protected town. Since it was guarded by wise and holy men, it was impossible to conquer. Although I should just say 'wise.' King Aethelfrith, who named the town after his wife Bebba, was certainly not holy. He was the first Northumbrian king and such a ruthless and steely leader of his men, that the natives here, the Britons, called him 'The Destroyer.'

He has kept this kingdom together in troublesome times, and he and his son Oswald conquered vast areas of land to the west. Two centuries ago, our kingdom became the most powerful of Britain. King Oswiu gained supremacy over Mercia, becoming Brytenwalda. Those golden days are unfortunately gone. Not too far away from here, there is the holy island of Lindisfarne, where the Danes attacked us for the first time. Ever since that day, we have suffered from their raids. Now our kingdom is under the thumbs of those accursed Norsemen, and our ruler Ecgberht is nothing more than just a puppet in Jorvik. But here in Bebbanburh his influence is minimal, and good people of this town still resist.
Vorrei impostare una nuovo livello di tasse per questa città.
Certamente. Quante tasse vuoi farci pagare?
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse basso.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse alto.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse normale.
Veramente, ho cambiato idea.
Most certainly! We shall abide by your most gracious order.
Avete del lavoro per me?
In merito al lavoro che mi avete offerto...
In merito al lavoro che mi avete offerto...
In merito al lavoro che mi avete dato...
Ho alcune domande di natura politica da fare.
Come va il commercio qui?
How does the wealth of this region compare with the rest of the North?
I wish to buy a farmstead near this town and hire a foreman.
I have {reg25} cattle with me. Would you be interested in buying any?
Hmm, I wonder how many are 'borrowed'...
Hmm, I wonder if we really need more cattle...
I don't think cattle care who their owner is...
One can't eat silver, should one need to eat...
Alright, I'll pay you {reg26} peningas per head. Do we have a deal?
No, that's too little.
Agreed. The cattle are nearby and just lack someone to fetch them.
You already operate a {s4} here, and no one around here is selling his farm.
Of course, {reg59?my lady:sir}. You are the lord of this town, and no one is going to stop you.
Well... Given your relationship with our lord, {s4}, I think that you will not find many here who are brave enough to sell you a farm.
Well, to be honest, I think that we in the town would like to know you a little better. We can be very particular about outsiders coming here and buying a farm.
Very good, {reg59?my lady:sir}. We in the town know and trust you, and I think I could find someone to sell you the land you need.

There are a couple of things to keep in mind. Skilled foremen are always at a premium, so I doubt that you will be able to buy more land here. In order to make a profit for yourself, you should choose a commodity which is in relatively short supply, but for which the raw materials are cheap. A farmstead can engage in many economic activities, especially in enhancing production of local products.
It must have a mill and bakery, to make bread from wheat
It must have a brewery, to make ale from wheat
It must have a foundry, to make tools from iron
It must have a weavery, to make wool cloth from wool
It must have a weavery, to make linen from flax
Non importa

Very good, {reg59?my lady:sir}. The farmstead and the materials out of which you can build your {s3} will cost you {reg7} peningas. Right now, your {s3} will produce {s4} worth {reg1} peningas each week, while the {s6} needed to manufacture that much will be {reg2}, and labor and upkeep will be {reg3}.{s9} I would guess that your profit will be {reg0} peningas a week. This assumes of course that prices remain constant, but, I can virtually guarantee you, they will not. Do you wish to proceed?
Yes. Here is money for the farmstead.
No, questo al momento attuale non è conveniente per me.
Very good. Your farmstead should be up and running in about two weeks. Whenever you visit after that, you can speak to your {s4} about its operations.
[Abbandona]
I am the mayor of {s9}. I can help you find a job if you are looking for some honest work.
Chi governa questa città?

Our town's lord and protector is {s10}. {s10} owns the castle and sometimes resides here and collects taxes from the town. However, we regulate ourselves in most of the matters that concern ourselves. As the town's mayor, I have the authority to decide those things.{s33}
Era tutto ciò che volevo sapere. Grazie.

Politics? Good heaven, the guild has nothing to do with politics. We are loyal servants of {s10}. We merely govern our own affairs, pass on the townspeople's concerns to our lords and masters, and maybe warn them from time to time against evil advice. Anyway, what did you wish to ask?
Ho già detto che qui siamo tutti {s9}? perché non posso sottolinearlo mai a sufficienza... Comunque... C'e altro?
What is the cause of all these wars in the Northlands?

Well, to answer your question generally, each monarch claims to be the rightful heir to the title of Brytenwalda, ruler of Englaland. Some of these claims are based on forgotten dynastic marriages and others are based on obscure promises, while some others are forged through sheer strength of arms. So in theory, any one realm has the right to declare war on any other realm at any time.

In practice, to make war is exhausting work. It is easy enough to lay waste to the enemy's farmland, but crops will grow back, and it is a far different matter to capture an enemy stronghold and to hold it. So the monarchs of the Northlands will fight a little, sign a truce, fight a little more, and so on and so forth. Often, a monarch will go to war when another realm provokes them. At such times, some bad influences who look to enrich themselves with ransoms and pillage will clamor for retribution, and thus the damage caused by war to a monarch's treasury is less than the damage caused by doing nothing would be to his authority... I'm of course not talking about {s10}, as no one would ever question {reg4?her:his} authority

I would stress again that us merchants have nothing to do with politics. But if {s10} were to ask for my advice on these matters, as a loyal subject, I would tell {reg4?her:him} that while {reg4?her:his} claim to all of the Northlands is truly just, even the most legitimate claim must be backed by armed men, and armed men want money, and money comes from trade, and war ruins trade, so sometimes the best way to push a claim is not to push it, if you know what I mean...

Potete dire a {s10} questo se {reg4?la:lo} vedete. Non fate precisamente il mio nome, naturalmente... Dite soltanto 'il popolo di {s4}' mi ha detto questo. La nostra opinione personale, ovviamente, coincide con i migliori interessi di {s10}. Nessuno di noi si sognerebbe mai mettere in discussione il diritto sovrano di un monarca ad ottenere le {reg4?sue:sue} legittime pretese.
What is {s10}'s policy in regards to the other realms of the Northlands?
Quale regno avevate in mente?
Cosa mi potete dire sulla politica interna dei regni?

Well, here in the {s4}, we are all united by our love for {s5} and support for {reg59?her:his} legitimate claim to the rulership of all these lands, but I have heard some talk of internal bickering in other realms...

I signori di un regno spesso hanno idee molto diverse circa l'onore, la strategia, e il modo in cui un nobile dovrebbe comportarsi... Inoltre, essi sono in concorrenza tra di loro per conquistare il favore del Re, e controllano costantemente la loro posizione gerarchica, quella dei loro amici e della famiglia, nonché la condizione dei loro nemici.

Alla base di tutte le tensioni c'è la possibilità che un signore possa abbandonare il proprio sovrano, e rendere omaggio ad un altro. In teoria, ogni signore ha prestato un giuramento di vassallaggio, ma in pratica, un vassallo può sempre trovare una scusa per assolvere se stesso da quest'obbligo. Il vassallo può affermare che il sovrano non è riuscito a tener fede ai suoi obblighi, come proteggere il vassallo e trattarlo con giustizia. In alternativa, il vassallo può affermare che il suo sovrano è in realtà un usurpatore, che un altro ha maggior diritto di regnare in luogo suo.

Sovrani e vassalli si controllano costantemente a vicenda e con grande attenzione. Se un Re ritiene che un suo vassallo stia per cambiare bandiera o stia per ribellarsi, allora può accusare il vassallo di tradimento ed espropriare i suoi possedimenti. Allo stesso modo, se un vassallo teme d'essere incriminato, può ribellarsi. Di solito, chi fa la prima mossa è in grado di controllare la fortezza del vassallo.

Now, men do not trust a vassal who turns coat easily, nor do they trust a king who lightly throws around charges of treason. Those two factors can keep a realm together, but if relations between a vassal and a liege deteriorate far enough, things can become very tense indeed... In other lands, of course. These things could never happen here in the {s4}.
È tutto. Grazie.
Cosa mi sapete dire?
Cosa succede se non completo l'incarico?
Ci sto ancora lavorando.
Bene. Ho fiducia che riuscirete a portare a termine il compito.
Bene. Ho fiducia che riuscirete a portare a termine il compito.
Certamente. Vi ho portato {reg5} carichi di {s33}.
Good news, {playername}. I will let the merchant know, so he can come and get his materials. For now, please take the {s33} you brought to the storage over there. And of course, here is your reward.
Good news, {playername}. I will let the merchant know, so he can come and get his materials. For now, please take the {s33} you brought to the storage over there. And of course, here is your reward.
Eh, volete rifletterci. Bene...
Spero che questo incarico non sfoci in un fallimento. In quel caso, dovrò chiedervi il prezzo del carico che stavate trasportando.
Spero che questo incarico non sfoci in un fallimento. In quel caso, dovrò chiedervi il prezzo del carico che stavate trasportando.
Bene, fate del vostro meglio per portare a termine l'incarico.
Bene, fate del vostro meglio per portare a termine l'incarico.
Eccellente. Conto su di voi. Buona fortuna.
Eccellente. Conto su di voi. Buona fortuna.
Bene, il lavoro sarà disponibile per alcuni giorni. Tornate quando volete, se sarete ancora interessato.
Bene, il lavoro sarà disponibile per alcuni giorni. Tornate quando volete, se sarete ancora interessato.
Bene, sembrate abbastanza capace. Forse ho qualcosa che posso farvi fare.

Ultimamente abbiamo affrontato dei combattimenti nella zona di {s5}, con tutto il caos che c'è stato alcuni briganti ne hanno approfittato per saccheggiare fattorie e relativi beni. Ho bisogno di qualcuno che dia loro una chiara lezione. Avete interesse in questo incarico?
Va bene, lo farò.
Mi spiace, ma al momento non posso accettare quest'incombenza.

Excellent! You'll find the looters roaming around the countryside, probably trying to rob more good people. Kill or capture the bastards, I don't care what you do with them. I'll pay you a bounty of 40 peningas on every band of looters you destroy, until all the looters are dealt with.

Beh, c'è un favore molto grande che potreste farci... Come forse avrete sentito, alcuni {s10} hanno attraversato il confine per attaccare il nostro popolo. {s5} è messo sotto grande pressione da alcuni dei suoi più bellicosi vassalli affinchè risponda con una dichiarazione di guerra. Sfortunatamente, mentre i grandi signori di questa terra si arricchiscono con gli spargimenti di sangue, noi comuni cittadini ne saremmo presi in mezzo con gravi sofferenze.

Non stiamo dicendo che {s5} dovrebbe trascurare quest'aggressione, anzi! Ma se incarica uno dei suoi signore di rispondere, allora il ciclo di provocazioni porterà necessariamente ad un confronto vero e proprio. Ora, se un estraneo dovesse intervenire e sconfiggere un signore di {s10} in battaglia, giustizia sarebbe fatta, e questo disinnescherebbe il clamore per la guerra. Se il signore sconfitto fosse un noto piantagrane, {s7}, allora il {s10} potrebbe anche dimenticarlo.

We need you to attack and defeat {s7}. This will not be an easy task, and that outsider would damage {reg59?her:his} relationship with the {s10}s, but we would be very grateful. We could not acknowledge a connection with that outsider, but we could be sure that {reg59?she:he} would be handsomely rewarded... Could you do this?
Si, lo farò.
I would prefer not to get mixed up in such things.

The Norwegian Vikings are likely to have hidden their ships in a well-concealed cove, somewhere along the coastline, preferably next to a small stream where they have access to fresh water. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of raiders who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

The Vikings are likely to have hidden their ships in a well-concealed cove, somewhere along the coastline, preferably next to a small stream where they have access to fresh water. The best way to discover its location would be to find a band of them who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow their tracks.

Bandits such as these usually establish their hideouts in the plain. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually establish a base in the highlands, often on a steep ledge where they have a view of the surrounding countryside. This makes them difficult to surprise. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of mountain bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually establish a base in the highlands, often on a steep ledge where they have a view of the surrounding countryside. This makes them difficult to surprise. The best way to discover its location would be to find a band of them who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow their tracks.

Banditi come questi di solito stabiliscono il loro accampamento all'interno della foresta, a volte nel bel mezzo di una palude. Il modo migliore per scoprire la loro posizione è quella di trovare un gruppo di banditi che sembrano essere di ritorno alla loro base per fare rifornimento, e seguirli.

Banditi come questi di solito stabiliscono il loro accampamento all'interno della foresta. Il modo migliore per scoprire la loro posizione è quella di trovare un gruppo di banditi che sembrano essere di ritorno alla loro base per fare rifornimento, e seguirli.
Va bene, lo farò.
Mi spiace, ma al momento non posso accettare quest'incombenza.
Molto bene. Ci aspettiamo notizie del vostro successo.
Abbiamo sentito che {s4}, alcuni viaggiatori sulla strada {reg4?per:da} {s5} sono stati attaccati da {s7}.

Vogliamo che voi abbattiate questi {s4}. I mercanti della città sono in grado di fornire una descrizione del loro capo, e hanno messo insieme una taglia. Se riuscite a dar loro la caccia e distruggerli, vi dimostreremo che ne sarà valsa la pena...
Va bene, lo farò.
Molto bene. La banda potrebbe anche aver lasciato la zona, ma è probabile che saranno individuati da altri viaggiatori lungo la loro strada.
Mi spiace, ma al momento non posso accettare quest'incombenza.
State cercando un lavoro? Io sono alla ricerca di qualcuno per una consegna a {s4}. Se v'interessa...
Ho un carico di {s6} che dev'essere consegnato alla sala dell'idromele di {s4}. Se volete portare {reg5} unità di {s6} a {s4} in 7 giorni, potreste guadagnare {reg8} denari. Cosa ne dite?
Certamente. Farò la consegna.
Mi dispiace ma non posso trasportare tutto quel carico ora.
State cercando un lavoro? Attualmente sto cercando qualcuno che scorti una carovana. Forse potreste farlo voi...

I am going to send a caravan of goods to {s8}. However, with all those bandits and deserters on the roads, I don't want to send them out without an escort. If you can lead that caravan to {s8} in 15 days, you will earn {reg8} peningas. Of course, your party needs to be at least {reg4} strong to offer them any protection. Also, keep in mind that the caravan may need to travel over the sea to get to its destination. Also ferries and ships hired for transport in port towns will be unable to carry the cargo. So you may need to own a ship to be able to escort it.
Bene. Scorterò la carovana.
Mi dispiace ma non ho abbastanza soldati per farlo.
Spiacente. Ora non posso farlo.
Possiamo fare il resto del percorso per conto nostro. Grazie.
Bene, abbiamo quasi raggiunto {s21}. Possiamo fare il resto del percorso per conto nostro. Ecco la vostra paga... {reg14} denari. Grazie per averci scortato. Buona fortuna.
Salve. Dovete essere la scorta che attendevamo, giusto?
Si. Il mio nome è {playername}. Vi condurrò a {s1}.
Well, it is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?
Eh. Lo abbiamo fatto per tanto tempo... Cosa volete che facciamo ora?
Seguiteci. Vi porteremo su una strada sicura.
Bene. Saremo subito dietro di voi.
State qui per un pò. Andrò avanti a controllare la strada.
Bene. Come comandate, Vi aspetteremo qui.

Effettivamente, stavo cercando una persona abile come voi. C'è questo gruppo di banditi particolarmente fastidiosi. Stanno infestando i dintorni della nostra città e stanno predando le nostre carovane. Sono sfuggiti a tutti i soldati e alle milizie fin'ora. Se qualcuno non li ferma presto, sarò rovinato...
I will reward you handsomely if you hunt down those troublesome bandits. It's dangerous work. But I believe that you are the {reg59?one:man} for it. What do you say?
Bene. Scaccerò questi banditi.
Lo farete davvero? Sono così contento di sentirlo... Buona fortuna.
Spiacente. Ora non ho tempo per questo.

Actually, I was looking for a reliable {reg59?helper:man} that can undertake an important mission. A group of bandits has kidnapped the daughter of a friend of mine and is holding her for ransom. My friend is ready to pay them, but we still need someone to take the money to those rascals and bring the girl back to safety.

L'importo che i banditi chiedono come riscatto è {reg12} peningas. Ti darò quei soldi una volta che accetti di prendere la missione. Hai 15 giorni per prendere i soldi per i banditi che saranno in attesa vicino al villaggio di {S4}. Quei bastardi hanno detto che uccideranno la povera ragazza se non ottengono i soldi in quel momento. Otterrete la vostra retribuzione di {reg8} peningas quando si porta la ragazza in modo sicuro di nuovo qui.
Va bene, porterò i soldi del riscatto ai banditi e porterò indietro la ragazza.

Buona. Sapevo che potevamo fidarci di te. Ecco i soldi del riscatto, {reg12} peningas. Contarlo prima di prenderlo. E per favore, non tentare di fare niente di avventato. Tenete a mente che il benessere della ragazza è più importante di qualsiasi altra cosa...
Spiacente. Ora non ho tempo per questo.
Grazie infinite per avermi portato indietro! Non vedo l'ora di rivedere la mia famiglia. Arrivederci!
Si. Venite con me. Andiamo a casa.
Purtroppo, non si dispone di spazio nel vostro partito per me.\n5350
Oh, veramente? Grazie tante!
Aspettate qui ancora per un pò. Tornerò da voi, non preoccupatevi.
Oh, per favore {reg59? signora: Signore}, non lasciarmi qui tutto solo!
Oh {reg59? signora: Signore}. Grazie mille per avermi salvato. Mi porti alla mia famiglia adesso?
Si. Venite con me. Andiamo a casa.
Purtroppo, non si dispone di spazio nel vostro partito per me.\n5350
Oh, veramente? Grazie tante!
Aspettate qui ancora per un pò. Tornerò da voi, non preoccupatevi.
Oh, per favore {reg59? signora: Signore}, non lasciarmi qui tutto solo!
Posso venire con voi adesso?
Siete voi a portare il riscatto? Forza, dateci i soldi adesso!
Siete di ritorno? Avete agito con rapidità, dateci i soldi adesso!
Ecco, prendete i soldi. Solo lasciate libera la ragazza.
Heh. Avete portato la somma esatta. Ora potete prendervi la ragazza. È stato un piacere fare affari con voi...
Niente da fare! Lasciate prima la ragazza.
Idiota! Smettetela di giocare e dateci i soldi!
Va bene. Ecco i vostri soldi. Lasciate la ragazza adesso.
Ho lasciato i soldi in un posto sicuro. Fatemi andare a prenderli.
State mettendo alla prova la nostra pazienza o cosa? Andate e portate quei maledetti soldi subito!
Non ho intenzione di pagarvi proprio nulla. Pretendo che rilasciate la ragazza, ora!
Non pretenderete niente, quando sarete morto.
Cosa? Ci avete dato i soldi. Non abbiamo più nessun affare da concludere.
Scusate per avervi recato disturbo. Continuerò per la mia strada, adesso.
Ora abbiamo un altro affare da concludere... Mi ridarete indietro i soldi.
Ah, quell'affare! Certo...
Oh {reg59? signora: Signore}. Grazie mille per avermi salvato. Mi porti alla mia famiglia adesso?
Si. Venite con me. Andiamo a casa.
Sfortunatamente. Non avete spazio nella vostra Compagnia per ospitarmi...
Oh, veramente? Grazie tante!
Aspettate qui ancora per un pò. Tornerò da voi, non preoccupatevi.
Oh, per favore {reg59? signora: Signore}, non lasciarmi qui tutto solo!
Sfortunatamente, ho perso la ragazza per strada...
Oh no! Come farò a dirlo al mio amico?
Mi dispiace. Non ho potuto farci niente, si è allontanata...

Mi hai lasciato giù {playername}. Mi ero fidata di te. Lascerò che la gente sappia della vostra incompetenza a questo compito. Inoltre, voglio indietro che {reg8} peningas ti ho dato come tassa di riscatto.
Certo. Ecco...
Almeno avete avuto la decenza di ridarmi i soldi.
Spiacente. Non ho quella cifra con me.
Vi aspettate che ci creda? Oh, Pagherete il compenso del riscatto! Andate e portate i soldi ora!

Questa guerra tra il {s15} e {s14} ha portato la nostra città sull'orlo della rovina. Il nostro coinvoglio è stato razziato prima che raggiungesse la destinazione. I nostri commercianti hanno paura di lasciare la sicurezza della cinta muraria. E come se quelli non sono sufficienti, le tasse per mantenere la guerra portar via gli ultimi bit dei nostri risparmi. Se la pace non tornerà presto, abbiamo non possiamo aspettare molto più a lungo.
Hai ragione, ma chi può fermare questa pazzia chiamata guerra?
È vostro compito aiutare i nobili nei loro sforzi. Non dovreste lamentarvene e basta.

Hah. I nobili... Combattono in guerra per la loro avidità e i loro sogni di gloria. Ed è la povera gente onesta come noi che si addossa i veri oneri. Ma ovviamente anche vossignoria non vorrà ascoltare...

Ci sono stati tentativi di riconciliare le due parti per raggiungere un accordo. Tuttavia, ci sono signori potenti da entrambi gli schieramenti a cui interessa restare in un continuo stato di guerra. Questi uomini spingono tutti gli altri non a ascoltare le parole delle persone ragionevoli, ma a continuare a lottare. Finchè questi comandanti rimarranno influenti, nessun accordo di pace sarà mai raggiunto.
Chi sono questi guerrafondai che bloccano la strada per la pace?
Chi sono questi signori di cui parlate?
Sono {s12} da {s15} e {s13} da {s14}. Fino a quando non cambiano la loro mente o perdono la loro influenza, ci sarà alcuna possibilità di avere la pace tra le due parti.
Cosa può esser fatto in proposito?
Ahimè, sembra che nulla possa invertire gli eventi...

Ci sarebbe un modo per risolvere la questione. Una persona particolarmente determinata potrebbe forse persuadere uno di questi signori o entrambi ad accordarsi per la pace. Ed anche se fallisse, sarebbe possibile fare in modo che questi signori vengano sconfitti con la forza e ridotti in prigionia. Se fossero detenuti, infatti, perderebbero la loro influenza e non potrebbero più opporsi ad un accordo... Cosa ne pensate? Potreste farlo?
Sembra difficile, ma ci proverò.
Se il prezzo fosse equo, potrei...
Scordatelo. Questo non è un mio problema.

La maggior parte dei mercanti della città volentieri si aprirà loro borse per supportare tale piano. Penso che possiamo raccogliere {reg12} peningas tra noi stessi. Saremo lieti di ricompensarvi con quella somma, se si può lavorare questo fuori. Convincere {s12} e {s13} per accettare un accordo di pace e se una di esse si rivela troppo testardo, assicurarsi che lui cade in cattività e non possono essere riscattati fino a quando un accordo di pace è risolta.
Va bene, farò il mio meglio.
Mi dispiace. Non ce la faccio.
Eccellente. Avete la nostra benedizione. Spero possiate trattare con quelle due vecchie capre. Noi vi aspetteremo sperando in buone nuove.
Non dire di no subito. Pensateci per un po di tempo. Se c'è un {reg59?signora:uomo} che riesce a farlo, quello sei tu.

Certo! C'è un gruppo di banditi che infestano la città, e io sono alla fine della mia corda su come trattare con loro. Sono stati imboscate e derubare i cittadini sotto la copertura della notte. Quindi svaniscono via, veloce come un fulmine, quando le guardie infine presentarsi. Non siamo stati in grado di catturare uno di loro. Attaccano solo persone solitario, mai osato mostrarsi quando c'è un gruppo circa. Ho bisogno di qualcuno che possa prendere su questi banditi da solo e vincere. Che sembra essere l'unico modo di portarli alla giustizia. Sei all'altezza del compito?

C'è un gruppo di banditi che infestano la città, e io sono alla fine della mia corda su come trattare con loro. Sono stati imboscate e derubare i cittadini sotto la copertura della notte. Quindi svaniscono via, veloce come un fulmine, quando le guardie infine presentarsi. Non siamo stati in grado di catturare uno di loro. Attaccano solo persone solitario, mai osato mostrarsi quando c'è un gruppo circa. Ho bisogno di qualcuno che possa prendere su questi banditi da solo e vincere. Che sembra essere l'unico modo di portarli alla giustizia. Sei all'altezza del compito?
Uccidere banditi? Certamente!
Le mie scuse, ma non ho interesse in questi incarichi.
Ciò mi toglie un bel peso dalle spalle, {playername}. Vi attende una lauta ricompensa se tornerete con la vittoria. Vedete di non farvi trucidare, eh?
Uno dei mercanti qui sta cercando di pastori a prendere il suo bestiame al mercato in {s13}.

La mandria di bestiame deve essere alle {s13} entro 30 giorni. Prima è meglio, molto meglio, ma si deve essere assolutamente non più tardi di 30 giorni. Se è possibile farlo, sarei disposto a pagarti {reg8} peningas per il disturbo. Ti interessa?
Si, posso portare il bestiame a {s13}.
Mi dispiace, ma debbo rifiutare.
Splendido. È possibile trovare la mandria proprio fuori la città. Dopo prendete gli animali per {s13}, tornate da me e otterrete la vostra paga.
Non c'è problema. Sarà riportare il tuo {s13}.
Mi dispiace, ma debbo rifiutare.
Sì, vi porterà un sacco di {reg33} di {s33}.
Mi dispiace, ma debbo rifiutare.
Splendida. Buona fortuna per trovare il furfante e portare il mio {S13} indietro.
Splendida. Buona fortuna per trovare il furfante e portare il mio {S13} indietro.
Splendida. Portate {reg33} carichi di {S33} qui, e vi rimborseremo per le vostre spese.
Splendida. Portate {reg33} carichi di {S33} qui, e vi rimborseremo per le vostre spese.
Ho paura di non potervi offrire un lavoro adesso.
Ho paura di non potervi offrire un lavoro adesso.
{reg59?Mia buona signora:Mio buon signore}. Il nostro villaggio vi è grato per il vostro aiuto. Grazie per i {reg5} capi di bestiame che ci avete portato, ora possiamo allevare la nostra mandria!
{reg59?Mia buona signora:Mio buon signore}. Il nostro villaggio vi è grato per il vostro aiuto. Lo schiavo sarà punito.
Mio buon {reg59?signora:signore}. Si è tentato, ma restituito senza lo schiavo. Immagino che non riusciva a trovare lui...
Mio buon {reg59?signora:signore}, per favore, c'è qualcosa che posso fare per te?
Non credo che possiamo ottenere ulteriori informazioni. Sembra che il tuo destino, il Wyrd, che si tiene a Danmark, amico mio.
{playername}, il prigioniero è in attesa di essere interrogato. Egli può avere alcune informazioni.
Wyrd bith ful araed!
{playername}, sei qui! Grazie a Dio! Navi vichinghe stanno arrivando! È Sven Bull Neck! Vuole distruggerci.
Ci dispiace, {reg59? il mio uomo: signora}. È tardi, e devo tornare a casa. Ci vediamo domani

Benvenuti a {s9}... Oh, aspetta! Tu sei il {reg59?signora:uomo} abbiamo trovato nel mare! Bello vedere voi, sicuramente più! Non osare spero di rivederti vivo. Che il guaritore può ancora risultare degno dell'eredità di suo padre, pace all'anima sua!
Sei Thonkrik? Il mio nome è {playername}, e io sono in debito con Doccinga.
Thonkrik di Doccinga? io sono {playername}. Ho alcune domande.

That isn't necessary. No debt, my friend! Rescuing others from distress at sea is the duty of every fisherman! ^We found you unconscious, clinging to a plank and led by the tide. Fortunately, you were not far from the coast.
Well, {playername}, go ahead.
We were traveling on a ship, the Woden Ric, and were attacked by Vikings! That's the reason you found me in the sea.

I know the Woden Ric! It made landfall at Doccinga many times, because it had passengers seeking cures for the most terrible ills. ^The father of the healer who has healed you was a man well known for his skills in many parts, and thousands of people left everything to come here. Now that man has died, and unfortunately his son does not have his father's magic. ^I am sorry to hear that the Woden Ric was attacked by Vikings...
I was one of those people. My mother was sick, and now, maybe she... is dead.
My mother traveled with me. Did you find other people or... corpses where you found me?
The sea brings swollen corpses and wrecks to our shores sometimes, but nobody lately. Usually, Vikings take prisoners to sell as slaves...
Thonkrik, our ship was attacked by Sven Bull Neck. Have you heard of this name before?

{s1}^^Sven Bull Neck? Oh, my good God! It is a miracle then that you are alive. Sven is a murderer, and his men are demons. He takes no prisoners, kills the whole crew, and burns the ship with the corpses inside. ^He does not look for riches. Sven is more ambitious. Each year we pay a lot of money to him to leave us in peace.
Ha ucciso mia madre, così ora io ucciderò lui! Dimmi, dove posso trovare Sven?
Mia madre può avete condannata indipendentemente da ciò, ma sarà lui a pagare per attaccarmi! Dove si trova Sven?

{s3}^^To seek Sven? Are you crazy? You are not listening to me! Look around? See those men training here? They are hardened warriors, sent by our jarl! They are here to defend us from Sven's attacks. And we are lucky! Other villages don't enjoy as much importance to the jarl. ^No, no, I know nothing about Sven!
E allora cosa? Che non stanno cercando di Sven. Dove si trova Sven? Voglio una risposta adesso!
Thonkrik, I need your help. Don't you know I can help you kill Sven?

I don't have an answer for you. I am but a simple villager who yet, I may point out, retains his head. If you are so intent on your own destruction, you should ask the jarl of Kennemer. God has given you a second chance, saving your life, but now you intend to waste it. Good luck, but I cannot help more.
Thanks for everything.

{s1}^^{playername}, look at yourself! You are weak, puny! Almost dead just weeks ago saved by lowly fishermen. You've lost all your possessions. You don't have weapons, resources or men. I don't know where Sven keeps his hideout, but if you go there someday, you will meet your death.
I don't fear death, Thonkrik. I know what I want to do, and it is to kill Sven. Farewell!
I see you don't know anything. Thanks for everything. Farewell.

I see the determination in your eyes. Here, take these few coins and my advice along with them: find a job and forget about Sven. Otherwise, feel free to ask the jarl of Kennemer, he might be able to help you.
You are right. I don't know anything, but you can ask the jarl of Kennemer. Please take some food. You have a long journey ahead of you.
Calm down, Thonkrik! I'm here to help.
The young people of the village have gathered on the beach with the king's troops to try to prevent the landing of Sven Bull Neck, but they are few. Thanks for coming to our aid!
Finally, Sven is near. He will pay greatly for what he did to me.
Where are the men of {s4}?
{s2}^^Those boats are Sven's, that's for sure. He always leads them. But this many men... I've never heard of Sven Bull Neck attacking a village with so many. It looks like an invasion!

{s4} will not come, I know. Some of the people here sent messengers, too, like you and the king, but he did not respond.^^Normally, I would not talk about this openly, for they are Danish problems, but {s4} has left my people to their fate. In fact, I fear that all this is because of him.

{s2}^^I know people who work in the jarl's house, and it is rumored that he aspires to the throne of Friese... I should not say this, but Sven Bull Neck has been there in the past.^I fear that these boats are attacking Doccinga to bring Sven's warriors to help the jarl capture the throne, but these are just my assumptions.
Damn traitor. He's been playing with me.
I'll take care of that issue later. Right now, I have to stop an invasion.
Be careful with him, he is a dangerous man.
Ic bancie the! Thank you for coming to help, {playername}. I will join my people now. A huskarl from the king leads the defense.
Follow his orders. Please fight with us! Good luck.
What you want to do with the prisoner?
Kill him! He is a murderer and does not deserve to live.
Free him. I don't want his blood to weigh on our hands.
It will be done as you have said. As for you, what will you do now?

In Friese, I'm not wanted. I've earned powerful enemies against whom I cannot fight now, Thonkrik. My priority is my mother. I must save her. I will try finding passage to Danmark on some ship and looking for Sven Bull Neck. Maybe we will never meet again...
I know you'll be back someday...
Yes, with an army. The jarls and the king of Friese will pay for what they have done to me.
No, I hate this land. You will not see me again.
It is possible. If I return, I will stop in Doccinga to say hello, friend.
I understand it. You're a {reg59?woman:man} haunted by revenge: Sven, Sigurd, and now the jarl of Kennemer. I hope you find peace someday.
Then, may fate accept that someday you will make your way back.
So I hope! The people of Doccinga love and admire you. Here you will always find a bed to sleep on and fire to warm up by.
Now, I need to find a boat that is traveling to Ribe...

I can help you with that. One of the Sven's boats was left behind relatively undamaged and has been repaired in secret. It is our gift to you for saving us. The ship awaits you at a beach near Doccinga... and also someone else is waiting for you there. I have a favor to ask, {playername}.

You remember I told you that someone was in the house of the jarl of Kennemer? Someone passing me information? Well that person is my daughter. The jarl snatched her to serve in his house as a maid for his wife. She managed to escape from Kennemer, and now I want you to take her along. If the jarl finds her, he'd take her back to his house, or maybe he would kill her. I need you to do this for me, {playername}, and the boat is yours.
I'll take her with me and will protect her.
No. Where I'm going is no place for a girl. I cannot protect her. She should stay here.

Do not make me beg, my friend. Do you think you have several ships to choose from? There is no other mode of transportation for you. With Sven's attacks, merchants take weeks to come back here. You don't know what they did to my daughter in Kennemer, {playername}... I do not want her warming again the bed of any of the jarl's men. Sorry, but there is no choice: the ship and my daughter go together.
Well, I'll take her and the ship. Farewell, Thonkrik.
Wes gesund, my friend.
Wes gesund.
Buona giornata, {reg59?signora:signore}, e benvenuto a {s9}. Io sono il capo di questo villaggio.

Benvenuto a {s9}, mi{reg59?a signora:o signore}. Abbiamo hanno gioito alla notizia che voi siete {reg59?la nuova signora:il nuovo signore} del nostro umile villaggio. Io sono il capo del villaggio e sarei onorato di servirvi in qualsiasi modo che possibile.
{reg59?Mia signora:Mio Signore}, onorate il nostro umile villaggio con la vostra presenza.{s33}
Buona giornata, {reg59?signora:signore}, e benvenuto a {s9}. Io sono il capo locale di questo villaggio.
Good day. I am happy to see you back.
Buongiorno, {reg59?signora:signore}.
C'è qualcosa che posso fare per voi?
Sure, Thonkrik. Take me to him. It is time for some words.
Seguitemi.
I am looking for someone who may or may not be a ghost.
A ghost? Hah! Ghosts don't appear during the day! Try finding him at night!
A ghost? Ghosts don't appear on their own! You need to walk by him to wake him up.
Have you seen any {s22}-playing guards around here?
Strangers come and go to our village, {reg59?madam:sir}, but I doubt you'll run into him at this hour of the night. You would have better luck during the day.

Gli stranieri vanno e vengono qui nel nostro villaggio, {reg59?signora/signore}. Non ho visto o sentito nulla a riguardo, ma se si sta nascondendo qui, lo troverete sicuramente, ispezionando il villaggio.
Strangers come and go to our village, {reg59?madam:sir}. I have heard some sweet sounds of a {s22} lately, but don't know if... hmm... You are welcome to look around.
Caliacas? The abbot of Finian sent me.
Caliacas? Is everything well? We received your message.
Your village is safe. You will not have more problems with Morrigan.

Ah, the abbot is a good man to respond to our call so promptly! I asked him for three heroes, and in fact, three heroes have come! You are the last to arrive, so you are the most anticipated, since the evil that has befallen our land is terrible indeed. Many have died, others have fled, and the few that remain can hardly keep their sanity.
Stop! Three heroes? What do you mean?
Three heroes? You do not need so many. You have me. Dismiss them.

The evil that afflicts us is magical, so we must fight it with magic. Three is the number of the old gods, so the old man said three should be the number of heroes. Any other number will fail and die. At first, we did not believe him, you understand. We are Christians, and our priest said the old man was a pagan and should be burned, and that's what we did. But we were idiots. The old gods are still here, and they want revenge. Now the old man is dead and cannot aid us more, and our priest has disappeared.
You burned the poor old man? You deserve what you're going through!
No doubt, that old man had something to do with this. Better to solve this without him.
What else did this old man say?

Do our women and children also deserve this? And that old man was not poor. He prayed to demons, performed rituals, and sacrificed animals. He lived in a hut from which he sold potions and ointments. Many believe that it was because of him that all this evil is happening to us. That he invoked something... Therefore, when our priest ordered us to burn the old man, we locked him up in his hut and burned it to the ground, listening all the while to his screams and curses.

We should not have burned him. That old man was powerful. He prayed to demons, performed rituals, and sacrificed animals. He lived in a hut from which he sold potions and ointments. Many believe that it was because of him that all this evil is happening to us. That he invoked something... Therefore, when our priest ordered us to burn the old man, we locked him up in his hut and burned it to the ground, listening all the while to his screams and curses. The only advice he left us was that we should bring three heroes, or the evil that lurks around us will end up destroying us.

That old man was powerful. He prayed to demons, performed rituals, and sacrificed animals. He lived in a hut from which he sold potions and ointments. Many believe that it was because of him that all this evil is happening to us. That he invoked something... Before our priest ordered us to burn him, he told us that we should bring three heroes, or the evil that lurks around us will end up destroying us.
You were right to call three heroes then.
What evil is attacking you?
Yes, I think it was the right thing to do. I'm also glad that the abbot respected my reasons, for anyone might have thought us to be heretics.

A month or so ago, a shepherd disappeared. A few days later, we found his dismembered body near an old tree. That scared us, because an animal would never do that to a man. After that, nobody left the village without a companion, but that did not help. A few days later, a group of people was attacked. Women and children disappeared, and we later found them dismembered.

--His hands tremble as he speaks.--^^Then we hired a group of Norsemen for a lot of money, but evil did the same to them as to our people, and their dismembered bodies were soon food for the crows.^^Then the old man told us to invite three heroes. Then we burned him.
Did you ask your lord for help?
You talk about evil. Why suspect the supernatural?

--He sighs heavily.--^^Yes, that was the first thing we did. He sent a group of twenty warriors. They were found dead and dismembered a few days later. Now our lord says he cannot send more men. He needs them for his wars. Since he had left us to our own devices, we asked the abbot.

The old gods are back, thirsty for blood after so many centuries.^^They have not only killed people and warriors, but we have seen them watching the village from afar. They announce they are coming for us. One of these days, the fog will fall, and then we all will die.
When there is fog, we can hear their singing and the howl of their wolves. We can even see their figures between dark wisps of fog. The creatures are huge. Well, all except her.
Her? A woman?
(Non sai niente)
No, not a woman, she is something else... The ancient gods have sent her to kill us all.
--He lowers his voice to a whisper.--^^She is Morrigan, the Phantom Queen, the pagan goddess of battle and... carnal encounters. She was worshipped before Saint Patrick brought us the word of Christ.
A shield-maiden?
(Non sai niente)
What! Please speak lower. Morrigan might hear us. No, she is powerful through magic rather than through physical strength.

My grandfather told me stories about her. The Raven Goddess selects who is going to be slain and takes the blood from their hearts, along with their valor. When they arrive on the battlefield, they are already doomed.^^She appears as a beautiful dark haired woman or sometimes as a crow. A beautiful maiden dressed with a hooded cloak, my grandfather said. She is usually to be found by a river, washing the clothes of men about to die. Centuries ago, she was one of the Tuatha De Danann, the demons that ruled the island before the Gaels arrived. Now she lives in Sidhe, the Underworld, whose entry is the ancient mounds.
She has left Sidhe and has brought her beasts with her. She will destroy us unless some hero defeats her and sends her back to her world.
I am that hero. Where might I find her?
I do not believe in this Morrigan, but I'll put an end to the murderers of your people.
She can't be defeated by one hero, so three were summoned. You should find them first.

The fog always comes from the coast, and with it come Morrigan and her beasts. You have to go there if you want to find her. The other two heroes await you near the burned hut of the old man, a few hours away from this village. They are looking for more clues as they await you. Be warned! When you leave this village and move towards the coast, be alert and flee from the fog, as Morrigan and her animals could catch you before the three of you are joined.
I pray Morrigan attacks me, so I get my reward sooner.
I will be alert, thank you. Farewell, then.
I'm glad to see you alive. Where are the other champions? I hope they are well. After you had left, we saw go behind you the beasts of Morrigan, and we feared the worst!
Yes, everybody is fine. You called me back for this?
Morrigan attacked me, but I am fine, and the other champions, too.

Err, yes, sorry. I sent the messenger to warn you of the danger. Since you are all well, I guess he succeeded in his mission. My intention was not to cause you to come here, but I understand how you might have interpreted it that way.
That's what I thought. Morrigan wanted to take you by surprise. We saw his wolves and bears following in your steps, and a brave lad volunteered to go to the hut of the old pagan to warn you.
Well, the other champions will send me notice of where Morrigan's camp is.
I lost some men in the battle with Morrigan. I need warriors.
I'll wait here for the messenger with news about Morrigan's lair. Send mead and women to my quarters.

In that case, {playername}, you're free to roam the village. Relax here or go hunting nearby, but beware of the fog. We have prepared the big house for you and your men, may its previous occupants rest in peace.

My {reg59?lady:lord}, many of our young people want to fight to avenge what happened. I do not like sending them to their deaths, but I could allow some to join you. Just promise me you'll take care of them, because they are heedless and impulsive.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, many of our young people want to fight to avenge what happened. However, I would be sending them to their deaths, as they are heedless and impulsive. Sorry.

It will be done, my {reg59?lady:lord}. The large house is for you and your men, may its previous occupants rest in peace. I will send our best food and mead. Our young girls will serve you and keep you company. It's the least we can do for our saviors. You are free to roam the village or go hunting nearby, but beware of the fog.

The large house is for you and your men, may its previous occupants rest in peace. I will send our food and mead, but excuse me, my {reg59?lady:lord} -- we prefer to keep our young girls far from your men, as is proper. You are free to roam the village or go hunting nearby, but beware of the fog.
Sure. I will take good care of them.
Then it would be better to leave those boys with their mothers.
I can think of {reg5} youths whom I suspect would join you. Does that suit you?
Any you can spare are welcome.
No, they please me not.

In that case, {playername}, you're free to roam the village. Relax here or go hunting nearby, but beware of the fog. We have prepared the big house for you and your men, may its previous occupants rest in peace.
Thank you for your hospitality, Caliacas. We will wait here until we receive information on where Morrigan's lair is. Then we will finish her off and bring peace back to your people.

--His face shows a disproportionate joy. He seems barely able to keep himself from hugging you.--^^You... you are a hero, my friend! You saved this village, and we will be eternally grateful.^Everyone in this village knows what you have done. You will always be welcome here as a hero. I also give you one of my children, the youngest, to join your army and serve under your name. His name is Bran, and he is very dear to me.
Thanks, Caliacas. I will take good care of him.
That's not necessary. I can't guarantee his safety.
You have saved many lives here. Thanks, {playername}! Return to the abbot of Finian. I'm sure he is ready to reward you and hear the good news. Good luck, my friend.
Sorry, but the decision is taken. I am not a rich man, but my children are strong and healthy, and I find no better way to reward you for what you've done.
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he might be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {reg59?madam:sir}, but I doubt you'll run into him at this hour of the night. You would have better luck during the day.
Gli stranieri vanno e vengono qui nel nostro villaggio, {reg59?signora/signore}. Se si sta nascondendo qui, lo troverete sicuramente, ispezionando il villaggio.
Per quanto riguarda il compito che mi avete assegnato...
Avete qualche compito in cui possa aiutarvi?
Voglio comprare delle provviste. Pagherò con dell'argento.
Ho bisogno di aumentare le leve.
Molto bene. Possiamo arruolare {reg33} persone. Desiderate procedere? Tenete a mente che prendendo gli uomini dai campi influirà negativamente il nostro villaggio.
Hmm, no, non voglio fare questo.
Sì, richiamare tutti gli uomini possibili. E prendi anche il tuo equipaggiamento.
As you wish, {playername}.
Yes, my {reg59?lady:lord}?
Ho un nuovo compito per voi.
What would you like us to do?
Seguitemi.
Certo.
I don't require your services any longer...
Thank you. We'll be happy to go back home.
Vorrei impostare una nuovo livello di tasse per questo forte.
[Abbandona]
Certamente. Quante tasse vuoi farci pagare?
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse basso.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse alto.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse normale.
Veramente, ho cambiato idea.
Most certainly. We shall abide by your most gracious order.
Vorrei impostare una nuovo livello di tasse per questo villaggio.
Certamente. Quante tasse vuoi farci pagare?
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse basso.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse alto.
Vorrei impostare un livello di tasse normale.
Veramente, ho cambiato idea.
Most certainly. We shall abide by your most gracious order.
Niente.
Naturalmente, {reg59?signora:signore}. Vuole acquistare merci o bestiame?
Voglio comprare merci e cibo.
We have some food and other supplies in our storehouse. Come and have a look.
Vorrei comprare del bestiame.
Ho {reg25} capi di bestiame che mi piacerebbe regalare al tuo villaggio.
Yes, definitely. Our people will be extremely grateful for such a generous gift.
Ho cambiato idea. Non ho bisogno di comprare niente.
Avete visto dei nemici nei dintorni di recente?
Sono spiacente, {reg59?signora:signore}. Non abbiamo visto nè sentito di nessun gruppo di soldati in questa zona.
Hmm. Fatemici pensare...
No, {reg59?signora:signore}. Non abbiamo visto nessun gruppo di soldati in questa zona, da molto tempo.
Bene, immagino sia tutto.

My {reg59?lady:lord}, I can beat and torture your enemies for your pleasure or if you want to make an enemy lord do something. For example, you can force an enemy lord to grant permission to court his daughter or sister, if such permission is hard to gain for you by any other means. Or you can force the lord to grant you parts of his rents from his fief for some time in exchange for freedom. If the lord is pagan and married, you can try to force him to divorce his wife. Then, of course, you will be free to pursue her as a free woman.
Thank you. That was informative.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, what can I do for you?
Torturer? What is it you can do?
I'd like you to have a little chat with one of the prisoners.
Nothing, I'm just checking the prison out.
Whom do you want me to talk to?
Niente.
Alright, what do you want me to do with {s10}?
Dump that bucket of water on him. Maybe then he'll come back to life.
I'd like you to hit his face, but be careful. He hasn't been ransomed yet.
Just beat him up... a little bit, but be gentle.
Warm up that iron rod. Let's see how well he can handle the heat.
Niente.
Very well, I will do that.
Very well, I will do that.
Very well, I will do that.
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!!!!!!!!
Whoooosh!!!!!!!!
Looks like he's alive, but he needs to recover a little bit for further conversations.
Looks like that one fell short. Shall we try something else?
Nient'altro?
I think the prisoner has passed out.
Ho bisogno che appicchiate un grande incendio al margine di questo villaggio.
We have already agreed upon this, {reg59?my lady:sir}. I will do my best. You can trust me.
A fire, {reg59?madam:sir}! Fires are dangerous! Why would you want such a thing?
I believe that we have already discussed this issue, {reg59?my lady:sir}.
We talked about this before, {reg59?madam:sir}. Your previous offers were low compared to risk you want me to take.
Io ho le mie ragioni, e voi avete le vostre... Una borsa di denaro è qui per voi. Lo farete o no?
Dato il rischio che state correndo, avete il diritto di conoscere il mio piano.
Devo liberare un prigioniero da {s4}. Dopo che avrete appiccato l'incendio, le guardie di {s4} vedranno il fumo, e alcune di loro usciranno per controllare cosa starà succedendo.
As you wish, {reg59?my lady:sir}. You have been a good friend to this village, and, even though there is a risk, we should be glad to return the favor. When do you want this fire to start?
I'm sorry, {reg59?my lady:sir}. You will forgive me for saying this, but we don't exactly have good reason to trust you. This is too dangerous.
As you say, {reg59?my lady:sir}, but in doing this, we are taking a very great risk. What's in it for us?
I can give you 100 peningas.
I can give you 200 peningas.
I can give you 300 peningas.
Niente.
Questa è follia! Non posso correre un simile rischio.
Then let's increase your reward to 200 peningas.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 peningas.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 peningas. This is my last offer.
Niente.
Molto bene. Mi state chiedendo di correre un grave rischio, ma lo farò. Quando volete che inizi l'incendio?
I cannot do such a dangerous thing for 200 peningas.
Continuate con i vostri preparativi. Un'ora da adesso, ho bisogno di quel fuoco.
Fatelo allo scoccare della mezzanotte. Aspetterò esattamente un'ora.
Very well, {reg59?my lady:sir}. We will make our preparations. Now you make yours.
As you wish, {reg59?my lady:sir}. May the heavens protect you.
I'm looking for men who are willing to follow me. I am recruiting...
Posso proteggere questo villaggio dalle minacce -- a pagamento.
Ach, not another one! For the sake of our families, I will pay your fee.
You have done well. Your families will thank you.
Hah, you joker, you... You don't fool me one bit!
Are there any stray dogs here?
Yes, recently I saw a stray dog. He was begging for food, but nobody here needs a new dog. I think he is currently sitting somewhere around here.
No, I haven't seen any stray dog here recently.
[Abbandona]
Abbiamo {reg5} capi di bestiame, ciascuno per {reg6} denari. Quanti ne vuoi comprare?
I am afraid we have no cattle left in the village, {reg59?madam:sir}.
Uno.
Due.
Tre.
Quattro.
Cinque.
Six.
Seven.
Eight.
Lascia stare.
I will tell the herders to round up the animals and bring them to you, {reg59?madam:sir}. I am sure you will be satisfied with your purchase.
Forget it! Why would I help an enemy of the kingdom?
Forget it! In this community, you are not welcome.
Unfortunately, I know of no one that may be interested.
Sicuro. Sei il benvenuto!
You do not look like anyone special. A wanderer like many others, with promises and words, but nothing more. Why should I help you find recruits?
I know you're someone feared. I'm not sure many men would want to join you.
What I can say...
I'll take some men that might be nothing but trouble and you would even get paid for that.
You know my reputation. Avoid damage to your people. Give me permission.
Take these 300 peningas for any inconvenience I may have caused.
I see I did not come at a good time. We'll talk again another day. Farewell.
Let's get down to business. Now, listen carefully.
I think this conversation is over. Farewell.
Your silver is music to my ears. Now, let us talk.
I am an honest person. Do you think I'll take your bribe? This conversation is over. Farewell.
Yes, I have heard of your iniquity and what you do against people. Let's see...

My influence here is vast. Many listen to what I say and do what I suggest. I will not allow you to take men who work the land, but there are others... landless losers that contribute nothing more than misery to the community. I could ask them to join you, but you don't look like much of a leader to follow. You will likely take them to their deaths, and they will never return. Surely, even people like them don't deserve such a fate.
Of course, your time and help will be rewarded.
I see what you trying to say, old man. Here, take these 500 peningas.
I think I did not come at a good time. Let us talk some other day. Farewell.
Of course, let's talk about that now.
It doesn't make sense to discuss things that are so vague. I think that I've been wasting my time with you. Farewell.

Well, you have my permission to take those troublemakers off my hands. I think they are eager for adventure anyway. You may go to the center of the village and take anyone loitering there. For every recruit you take from this village, I'll take a commission.
Si {reg59?signora:signore}, hai fatto qualche progresso?
Certamente. Vi ho portato {reg5} sacchi di grano.

My good {reg59?lady:lord}. You have saved us from hunger and desperation. We cannot thank you enough, but you'll always be in our prayers. The village of {s13} will not forget what you have done for us.
Mio buon {reg59?signora:signore}, per favore, c'è qualcosa che posso fare per te?
Sono ancora all'opera su questo.
Mi dispiace di non essere riuscito a portare al termine il compito.
Thank you, {reg59?madam:sir}. We are praying for your success every day.
Ah, I am sorry to hear that, {reg59?madam:sir}. I'll try to think of something else.
Well, {reg59?her:his} Highness is already engaged with a task helping us. We cannot ask more from you.
No, {reg59?signora:signore}. Non abbiamo altre attività per voi.
Un compito?

{reg59?My good lady:My good lord}, our village has been going through such hardships lately. The harvest has been bad, and recently some merciless bandits took away our wheat that we had reserved for the planting season. If we cannot find some seed soon, we will not be able to plant our fields and then we will have nothing to eat for the coming year. If you can help us, we would be indebted to you forever.
Hmmm. Di quanto grano avete bisogno?
Non mi posso occupare di questo genere d'incombenze. Chiedete a qualcun altro.
I think {reg5} packs of grain will let us start the planting. I hope that we can find charitable people to help us with the rest.
Bene, andrò a procurarvi il grano che vi serve.
Ho paura di non aver proprio tempo per questo. Dovrete chiedere aiuto altrove.
Thank you, {reg59?madam:sir}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Sì, {reg59?signora:signore}, certamente. Mi spiace avervi disturbato con questi nostri problemi.

{reg59?My good lady:My good lord}, we have a bit of a problem on our hands. Although the harvest was good, and we are not doing that badly either, too many of our men can't marry, because there are not enough women in our village, only God knows why. That brings about unnecessary tension among our men, and with it all kind of rowdy behavior and incessant fistfights. You look like a {reg59?lady:man} of the sword. Would you be able to capture and bring us some young women so our poor men can stop fighting and start farming?
I am not a kidnapper. Ask someone else to help you.
Sì, {reg59?mia signora:mio signore}, certamente. Mi spiace avervi disturbato con questi nostri problemi.
I'm not sure how common this is... Why not ask your lord to help you?
That sounds fascinating. Perhaps I will take you up on that offer when I'm ready...
You seem to know a lot about women, my good man. This all seems so logical now.
I have to admit I'm really excited about undertaking this mission.
Perhaps we should, I can smell a good reward coming my way.
Would you consider taking some of my women warriors instead?
C'è un premio?
I have to admit that you make a lot of sense.
Your men lack willpower, but they're lowly peasants after all...
Mi dispiace, ma non sei riuscito a convincermi.
Well, we will highly appreciate your {reg59?Ladyship's:Lordship's} helping us. What kind of reward do you have in mind?
I am glad that you can be made to see reason. Your {reg59?Ladyship's:Lordship's} help will be most appreciated, of course.
Yes, my {reg59?lady:lord}, these men are weak. They're chock full of temptations. Wouldn't it make sense for you to help them be at peace with themselves? Your help, of course, will be appreciated.

I apologize, my {reg59?lady:lord}, but my men hardly need spear-wielding warrior wives. They need women who can work the fields and take care of the animals, not pull a knife out when an argument arises.
